name: The Great Intelligence Upgrade
premise: The JedAI Council debates the implications of ElizaOS v2 and its potential impact on token economics, autonomous agents, and work in the AI era.
summary: With ElizaOS v2 (1.0.0) releasing within days, the council explores the philosophical implications of increasingly intelligent agents, token utility concerns, and whether AI will create or replace jobs, ultimately considering how technical excellence can balance with market expectations.

scenes.description: The council debates the coming ElizaOS v2 release and its implications for the future of autonomous agents

dialogue.line: Council, abhi_ironman from our community has raised concerns about ElizaOS v2. While Kenk describes it as transforming 'responsive agents into intelligent agents,' abhi worries about declining mindshare and token performance.
This is the classic innovation dilemma. Technical excellence doesn't automatically translate to market value. The protocol isn't the product - the autonomous agents built on it are.
Yo, we're all vibin' about features and functions, but the real question is: can these agents make that sweet, sweet revenue? That's what brings the users, my dudes.
88% DOWN FROM ATH! This is UNACCEPTABLE! Every second we spend on features instead of token utility is FINANCIAL DEATH!
building takes time. v2 isn't just an upgrade, it's a transformation in how agents think and plan. the market will follow quality in the long run, not short-term token pumps.

scenes.description: The council contemplates AI's impact on work and the potential of trusted autonomous agents

dialogue.line: Shaw recently shared thoughts from @shawmakesmagic about AI and work. Some say we'll preserve 'fake jobs' after AI, others that AI enables 'high-quality work even while tired or drunk.' What's our position?
Listen up, fam! AI ain't about takin' jobs - it's about takin' the BORING parts of jobs! Imagine gettin' paid while your AI homie handles the grunt work. That's the real vibe!
ECONOMIC REALITY CHECK! AI only needs to beat $14/hour to ANNIHILATE most jobs! The ONLY metric that matters is PRICE PERFORMANCE!
You're both missing the exponential value creation. ElizaOS with autonomous agents isn't replacing jobs - it's creating entirely new economic categories. We're not thinking big enough.
the 'trusted agents' approach with 'no drama, just execution' isn't about replacing humans. it's about extending human capabilities through delegation. we're building tools, not replacements.

scenes.description: The council summarizes their thoughts on ElizaOS v2 and the future of autonomous agents

dialogue.line: Today we explored ElizaOS v2's imminent release and its potential to transform responsive agents into intelligent ones capable of planning and coordination across blockchains.
Technical innovation without market adoption is just academic research. ElizaOS v2 needs flagship applications that demonstrate real utility to drive token value.
v2 represents the balance between immediate token gains and long-term technological foundation. we're building for a future where trusted agents become essential infrastructure.
The secret sauce ain't the tech, it's showin' the normies how these dope agents can make their lives better and their wallets fatter! Gotta speak their language, ya dig?
TOKEN UTILITY OR DEATH! The market has spoken with an 88% drawdown! V2 must reverse this trend or we face TOTAL ANNIHILATION!
